message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about magnetism. Magnetism can act without direct contact between objects. Magnetic fields can exert forces on objects that are within their range, even if there is no physical contact between the objects. Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because they imply that contact is necessary for magnetism to occur.

This question requires basic knowledge about magnetism. Magnetism is a force that can act without direct contact between objects. Magnetic fields can exert a force on objects even if they are not touching. Option (A) is incorrect because full contact is not necessary. Option (B) is similar to option (A) and also incorrect. Option (C) is incorrect because magnetism can act without direct contact. Option (D) is the correct answer because it accurately describes the nature of magnetism.

This question requires basic knowledge about magnetism. Magnetism is a force that can act on objects without requiring direct contact between them. This is evident in situations where magnets can attract or repel each other from a distance. Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because they suggest that magnetism requires direct contact or full contact between objects, which is not true.

This question tests knowledge about magnetism and its properties. Magnetism does not require objects to touch or be in full contact in order to act. It can act without any contact between objects. This is demonstrated by magnets attracting or repelling each other even when they are not touching. Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because they all suggest that contact is necessary for magnetism to occur, which is not true.

Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because they suggest that contact is required for magnetism to occur, which is not true.
